Title: A seller of laser equipment in the United States was charged with...
Description: A laser equipment seller in the US was charged with circumventing sanctions against the Russian Federation Sam Bhambhani, a global laser equipment seller from North Attleboro in Massachusetts, was arrested in the US. He is accused of conspiring to circumvent export restrictions on Russia, reports Reuters. The indictment states that he collaborated with a Russian citizen who resold laser equipment to the Russian government. To hide the end consumer, they used fake export documents. According to the investigation, between 2015 and 2021, laser equipment was sold to a Rosatom subsidiary in Yekaterinburg, which produces components for nuclear weapons and goods for civilian use. Russian Maxim Teslenko, a trade intermediary, has also been charged. Bhambhani is said to have discussed with him from time to time the need to find ways to circumvent US export controls to make sales possible. Teslenko himself lives in Moscow.

Title: An employee of a defense enterprise near Moscow wrote -Glory to U...
Description: An employee of a defense enterprise near Moscow wrote -Glory to Ukraine- and -Putin is a thief- on the key tags. He was given 3 years in prisonThe Dubna City Court sentenced Sergei Krasyuk, an employee of the Raduga design bureau (GKB) specializing in the creation of cruise missiles, to three years in prison, reported OVD-Info. According to investigators, at the end of January a man painted the inscriptions -Glory to Ukraine-, -Victory will be for Ukraine- and -Putin is a thief- on the key tags for cell phones for storing mobile phones at the enterprise. After this, the security chief blocked the doors and carried out a complete evacuation of the plant employees. As a result, the Raduga State Clinical Hospital did not work for 50 minutes, which led to damage of 237 thousand rubles. This became the reason for initiating a case for -discrediting- the army, which resulted in interference with work (Part 2 of Article 280.3 of the Criminal Code). Krasyuk admitted guilt, repented of his crime and compensated the damage to the defense enterprise in full at the preliminary investigation stage. The representative of the plant also explained at the court hearing that the damage to the enterprise was compensated in full. In addition, Krasyuk has two minor children. For these reasons, the defense insisted on imposing a sentence not related to imprisonment.Despite this, the court decided to send Krasyuk to a colony, he was taken into custody in the courtroom.

Title: ‚Ü©Ô∏èüñº -Tears welled up in his eyes and [he] was ready to burst int...
Description: ASTRA: An Irkutsk resident with mental retardation, sentenced to 10 years for -preparing for treason,- is sent from a pre-trial detention center to war. Sentenced to 10 years for posts on social networks and -preparation for treason,- 26-year-old resident of the Buryat village of Osa Sasha Matheev sent by the -cook... -Tears welled up in his eyes and [he] was ready to burst into tears,- Sasha Matheev, a retarded Irkutsk resident sentenced to 10 years for trying to join the Armed Forces of Ukraine, did not sign a contract with the Ministry of Defense, reported lawyerA 26-year-old resident of the Buryat village of Osa, diagnosed with mild mental retardation, Sasha Matheev will not go to war, the young man‚Äôs lawyer Vladislav Astakhov told ASTRA. Previously, that Matkheev is going to war as a cook reported the human rights project -First Department- with reference to Matheev‚Äôs letter to volunteers. -Tomorrow I will be taken to the Northern Military District to serve as a cook, and then, from there, home to my relatives, to my mother, to my cats, to my sister,- Matkheev wrote in a letter from the pre-trial detention center. -It‚Äôs hard to communicate with Alexander. He speaks in fragments. You have to think of complete answers for him and ask again. After which he agrees with my version of the answer. So it‚Äôs not clear where is his answer, and where is my version of his answer,- lawyer Astakhov explained in a conversation with ASTRA.Matheev‚Äôs diagnosis means that he has development at the level of a child. As ASTRA previously wrote - Matkheev was arrested as a result of a possible provocation by the FSB. He spent a long time communicating on the Internet with strangers, with whom he discussed serving as part of the -Freedom of Russia- Legion of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. FSB operatives detained Matkheev at a train station in the Kemerovo region - from there, at the suggestion of an anonymous interlocutor in a telegram, he wanted to use money from his credit card to travel to Kazakhstan in order to join the Armed Forces of Ukraine through the Ukrainian Embassy there. Mattheev was given 10 years in prison in April 2024. Certificates about his diagnosis were not considered at the trial. Tears welled up in his eyes and he was ready to burst into tears, but he restrained himself, especially since I tried to calm him down. As I understand it, this is his usual behavior - to cry in any difficult situation,- lawyer Astakhov told ASTRA. According to the lawyer, Matkheev wrote at least one statement to the Ministry of Defense. Whether he received an answer and, if so, what it was, is not known for certain. The main thing that the defender managed to find out is that Matkheev did not sign a contract with the Ministry of Defense. Sasha Matkheev was convicted under three articles of the Criminal Code - treason, propaganda of terrorism and participation in a terrorist organization - the Ukrainian Legion -Freedom of Russia- is recognized in Russia.

Title: üñº Elections in Russia: results of three days of voting Within three...
Description: Elections in Russia: the results of the three-day voting During the three days from September 6 to 8, Russia held elections for the heads of 21 regions. Among them, the governor of St. Petersburg was also elected. In addition, deputies of the Moscow City Duma were elected in Moscow, and in other regions - deputies of regional parliaments.In most regions, where preliminary voting results are already known, the incumbent governors won, and the United Russia party won the majority of votes. The exception was Bratsk in the Irkutsk Region, where self-nominated candidate Alexander Dubrovin won. According to preliminary voting results, Igor Babushkin (Astrakhan Oblast), Alexander Osipov (Transbaikalia), Andrei Besprozvannykh (Kaliningrad Oblast), Vadim Shumkov (Kurgan Oblast), Vyacheslav Fedorishchev (Samara Oblast), Valery Limarenko (Sakhalin Oblast), Vladimir Vladimirov (Stavropol Krai), Dmitry Demeshin (Khabarovsk Krai) got more than 80 percent of the votes. Chelyabinsk Region Governor Alexei Teksler, according to preliminary results, won almost 96 percent of the vote. There, children were made to stand with posters of Clean Victory and Fair Elections. Preliminarily, 38 Moscow City Duma deputies will represent United Russia, with the other seven representing other parties and self-nominated candidates.The Moscow City Election Commission said voter turnout was about 40 percent. Three million Muscovites voted electronically. The highest turnout was in Bashkortostan - more than 69 percent.The Interior Ministry reports that five criminal cases related to the elections in Russia have been opened. The reason was false reports of bombings. No serious violations were detected at the elections on the single day of voting, the agency emphasized. About 30 people were poisoned at polling stations in St. Petersburg. These are PEC members, security guards and police officers. The poisoning was caused by cooked lunches.Observers in different regions reported many violations. For example, in Ryazan Oblast, observers from the CPRF reported the absence of seals on ballot boxes at night. In Krasnodar Krai and Rostov Oblast, they reported ballot box stuffing; in Novosibirsk, Yekaterinburg and Kurgan, they reported vote buying.In Tomsk, Sergei Sechenov, an SVO veteran, was elected to the city council. He ran for the United Russia. Previously, the deputy from this district was Andrei Fateyev, who worked at Navalny's local headquarters.
